task.title: Show Edge Source
task.shortdesc: Clicking an edge displays the source of the data.

taskbody.context: The Edge Inspector shows the source of the label names, the relational structure or ontology, as well as the file source.

step.cmd: Hover over an edge linking two nodes together.
step.stepresult: The predicate label appears. The predicate describes the relationship between two nodes. In this example, "hasPoliticalAffiliation" indicates that Sophia King is affiliated with Radical politics.

step.cmd: Click on the edge to open the Edge Inspector.
step.stepresult: The Edge Inspector pop-up window shows the source of the label names, ontology and file.

step.cmd: Click on the URI for predicate to learn more about the relationship type and how it functions within the given ontology.
step.stepresult: The link takes the user to the CWRC ontology documentation, which describes the various properties of the predicate.

taskbody.example: In this case, the tag "hasPoliticalAffliation" is associated with the subject Domain:"Person" and has various Children Properties or sub-categories, including: "hasGenderedPoliticalAffiliation" and "hasPoliticalAffiliationReported."
taskbody.postreq: To close the window, click the button at the top right.
